metadata.title: CVE-2016-0718 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document,which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
xmlrpc-c package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
swish-e package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
firefox package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
